snippet: The chancellor of the Exchequer, George Osborne, said Chinese companies’ holdings would begin as minority shares but could grow into majority ownership.
abstract: Britain announces that it will allow Chinese firms to buy stakes in British nuclear power plants and eventually acquire majority holdings; plan opens way for China's fast-growing nuclear industry to play significant role in Britain's plans to proceed with construction of its first new reactors in nearly two decades.

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Stephen Castle reported from London and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong. Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Wuhan, China, and Stanley Reed from London.

lead_paragraph: The chancellor of the Exchequer, George Osborne, said Chinese companies’ holdings would begin as minority shares but could grow into majority ownership.

headline.main: Chinese to Invest in British Nuclear Power
headline.print_headline: Chinese to Invest in British Nuclear Power
